name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Stephen S. SKIBICKI, Petitioner

pin_cites.parenthetical: possible prejudice to a defendant from giving written instructions to a jury outweighs any benefit that such instructions might provide
possible prejudice to a defendant from giving written instructions to a jury outweighs any benefit that such instructions might provide

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Stephen S. SKIBICKI, Petitioner.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 21st day of August, 1996, the order of the Superior Court is REVERSED and the matter is REMANDED for a new trial. See Commonwealth v. Oleynik, 524 Pa. 41, 568 A.2d 1238 (1990)(possible prejudice to a defendant from giving written instructions to a jury outweighs any benefit that such instructions might provide); Commonwealth v. Baker, 466 Pa. 382, 353 A.2d 406 (1976)(same).
It is further ordered that the Application to proceed In Forma Pauperis is GRANTED.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
679 A.2d 1265
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Stephen S. SKIBICKI, Petitioner.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Aug. 21, 1996.
